page.title: 06Linton Lock Leisureways
page.content: Linton Lock, on the River Ouse, was built between 1775-1785 with a weir and a salmon ladder.The area,5.2 hectares, is owned by University College, Oxford and leased to Linton Lock Commissioners. The dimensions of the lock are 60ft.long,20ft.wide, 14-20ft.deep and it is used by cruisers from Ripon out to the Humber estuary and long boats from the south. Tourist facilities at Linton Lock include boat moorings for up to 40 boats,camping facilities, caravan pitches for 15 static vans and 60 tourers,a restaurant and parking facilities.Boats and canoes are available for hire.Fishing is very popular.The river is used by the British Canoe Association for championships.
